alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 5:37AM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY... .A series of cold upper level storm systems has lowered snow levels to around 2000 feet this morning, and may occasionally drop snow levels to sea level Saturday night through Monday morning. Periods of heavy showers spreading across the cold airmass will favor significant mountain snowfall lasting through Monday morning. Travel across mountain roadways and highway passes will subsequently be difficult if not impossible. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 17 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Northwestern Mendocino Interior County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
